AtomsRegionÔÉÅ

class ase2sprkkr.sprkkr.atoms_region.AtomsRegion(name, slice, cell, pbc=[True, True, True], inherit_cell=False, atoms=None, add=True)[source]ÔÉÅ

AtomsRegion define a region of Atoms object, that can have its own cell and pbc.

E.g. this system:

|^^T^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^T^^|
|  |                   |  |
|__|___________________|__|

has two semiinfinite 3D periodic regions and a central 2D-symmetric region.

Class hierarchy


Constructor

Parameters:

  • name (str)

  • slice (slice)

  • cell (Cell | ndarray)

  • pbc (List[bool | None])

  • inherit_cell (bool | List[bool])

  • atoms (Atoms)

__init__(name, slice, cell, pbc=[True, True, True], inherit_cell=False, atoms=None, add=True)[source]ÔÉÅ

Atoms region defines a spatial part of an Atoms object. The cell can has zero vectors - such vectors are taken from the parent atoms object.

Parameters:

  • slice (slice) ‚Äì Which sites (atoms) belong to the region

  • cell (Cell | ndarray) ‚Äì The primitive cell

  • pbc (List[bool | None]) ‚Äì The peridodicity vector (see ase.Atoms)

  • inherit_cell (bool | List[bool]) ‚Äì Inherit the cell and the pcb from the parent atoms for given axes. Use of this argument is the same, as setting pbc to None and cell to [0,0,0] for the given axes.

  • atoms (Atoms) ‚Äì The master object, of which the region is defined

  • name (str)

static from_atoms(from_atoms, name, slice, inherit_cell=False, atoms=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Creates a region from the property of the given atoms object. The pbc and cell are taken from it.

Parameters:

  • from_atoms (Atoms)

  • name (str)

  • slice (slice)

  • atoms (Atoms)

get_cell()[source]ÔÉÅ
property cellÔÉÅ

Return the cell.

If the cell has some zero vectors, these are replaced with parent atoms cell vectors

property pbcÔÉÅ

Return the pbc

If the pbc has None items, these are replace with parent atoms pbc values

property sliceÔÉÅ
_clear_cache()[source]ÔÉÅ

Set the master atoms - of which the region is described

Create an atoms object, that contains only the region

Return the symbols in the region
